(I read that the Destrons flew into the base, I'm assuming it's not the CF 
they're flying into^_^ Oh, and I apologize if it seems like I'm being a 
b*tch drunk on my own power, cause I am!! Mwuhahahaha! Just kiddin':P Only 
two more days of testing to go then I think I'll be back to normal^_^)

Tavatron:

The wind softly rustled what remained of the Prarie grass that surrounded 
the CF. Most of it had been burnt and mawled by the battle, but what little 
remained bent gently in the growing breeze. Her friend was right, the 
gestalts had made the difference. If not for them then the battle may have 
been won by theirs:

"I suppose. But our lack of organization was not of much help."

Who was she kidding?! They had been all over the place, with no real 
leadership. It wasn't IR's fault that some 'bots were just too slaggin' 
thick headed to listen to sound orders. Still, that was past, and if they 
got through this battle perhaps the Maximals would be able to unify. Their 
were too many seperate 'militias'. Tavatron did, however, catch Dinobot's 
reaction when she mentioned the wounded:

"Perhaps you should take the time to count all of those who fought and 
nearly died for this battle, even though it was a lost cause. It is said 
that blind faith is better than no faith. If they had no faith in our 
commander and our cause wouldn't they have run at the first signs of an 
Alliance victory? They deserve a chance to rest, even if it means 
surrendering to the Alliance."

Tavatron returned to Iron Raptors side opposite Dinobot. She wasn't angry 
with him, but would it fry his circuits just to show a little compassion 
every now and then? Sometimes he seemed impossible.
